sen.j: 作者付（さくしゃづけ）とは、能の曲目に関して、各作品の作者が誰であるかを列記した書物である。

sen.j: 室町時代後期には『能本作者註文』・『自家伝抄』などが成立し、江戸時代に入ると各家の所伝からなる作者付が幕府に提出された。
sen.e: Books such as "Nohon Sakusha Chumon" and "Jika Densho" were written during the latter part of the Muromachi period, and in the Edo period, sakushazuke containing the traditions of each playwright were submitted to the shogunate.

sen.j: 作者として挙げられているのは、喜阿弥・観阿弥・観世元雅・金剛権守・金春権守・福来・南阿弥・琳阿弥・山本某。

sen.j: 観世長俊は観世座の「脇の仕手」として棟梁である大夫を補佐した名人であり、また自身も作者としていくつかの能を残した人物である。
sen.e: Nagatoshi KANZE was a famous leading performer a at the Kanze-za Theater who also wrote several of his plays.

sen.j: そのため、長俊自身の作品、また長俊の父である観世小次郎信光、そして同時代に活動した金春禅鳳については、特に信頼度の高い資料である。
sen.e: As such, this is a particularly reliable resource for the works of Nagatoshi himself as well as his father, Nobumitsu KANZAKOJIRO, and Zenpo KONPARU who was also active during this period.

sen.j: 同時代の『自家伝抄』と比べても客観性のある内容で、その資料的価値は高い。
sen.e: Its content is objective even when compared to the contemporary publication "Jika Densho", making it a particularly valuable source.

sen.j: 反面、優れた曲で作者不明のものについてはほとんど全てを世阿弥の作とする一方、観阿弥・元雅といった重要な作者が掲載されていないなど、同時代以外の曲については不正確な記述も少なくない。
sen.e: Although while the outstanding songs for which the creators are unknown are almost all attributed to Zeami, the major writers Kanami and Kanze Motomasa are not included, and there are few incorrect descriptions relating to the period in which the book was written.

Although while the outstanding songs for which the creators are unknown are almost all attributed to Zeami, the major writers Kanami and Kanze Motomasa are not included, and there are few incorrect descriptions relating to the period in which the book was written.

On the other hand, although outstanding songs whose playwrights are unknown are almost all attributed to Zeami, the major writers Kanami and Motomasa are not included; as such, there are many incorrect descriptions relating to the songs other than those from the same period.

sen.j: 伝本については、寛文元年（1661年）加藤磐斎『謡増抄』の巻末に附載されて刊行されたものが最も古く、山崎美成『歌曲考』（文政3年、1820年）にも同じ内容が載る。
sen.e: Of the surviving copies, the oldest is that appended to the end of Bansai KATO's "Utaizosho" and published in 1661, which contains the same content as Yoshinari YAMAZAKI's "Kakyokuko" (1820).

sen.e: In addition to also being appended to the end of Utai RYOHO's " Takasago Zozosho" published in 1736, there is also the copies owned by institutions such as Shokokan.

sen.j: 書名については本来無題、あるいは『能作者』、『謡作者』であったと見られるが、1915年『禅竹集』に吉田東伍が翻刻した際、『能本作者註文』の題で収録して以来、この名が定着している。
sen.e: The book was originally untitled or may have been entitled "No Sakusha" or "Utai Sakusha" but the name "Nohon Sakusha Chumon" has stuck since it was recorded under this title when it was reprinted in " Zenchiku Shu"by Togo YOSHIDA in 1915.

The book was originally untitled or may have been entitled "No Sakusha" or "Utai Sakusha" but the name "Nohon Sakusha Chumon" has stuck since it was recorded under this title when it was reprinted in " Zenchiku Shu"by Togo YOSHIDA in 1915.

The book was originally untitled or may have been entitled "No Sakusha" or "Utai Sakusha" but the name "Nohon Sakusha Chumon" took hold since it was recorded under this title when it was reprinted in "Zenchiku Shu" by Togo YOSHIDA in 1915.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 作者として挙げられているのは、世阿弥・観世信光・観世長俊・金春禅竹・金春禅鳳・宮増・近江能・三条西実隆・竹田法印定盛・細川弘源寺・音阿弥・太田垣忠説・金春善徳・内藤藤左衛門・河上神主・「作者不分明能ただし大略金春能か」。
sen.e: Zeami, Nobumitsu KANZE, Nagatoshi KANZE, Zenchiku KOMPARU, Zenpo KONPARU, Miyamasu, No Omi, Sanetaka SANJONISHI, Sadamori Hoin TAKEDA, Hosokawa Kogenji, Onami, Tadatoki OTAGAKI, Yoshinori KONPARU, Tozaemon NAITO and Kawakami Kannushi are listed as writers while those noh plays for which the writer is unknown are attributed to the Konparu family.

Zeami, Nobumitsu KANZE, Nagatoshi KANZE, Zenchiku KOMPARU, Zenpo KONPARU, Miyamasu, No Omi, Sanetaka SANJONISHI, Sadamori Hoin TAKEDA, Hosokawa Kogenji, Onami, Tadatoki OTAGAKI, Yoshinori KONPARU, Tozaemon NAITO and Kawakami Kannushi are listed as writers while those noh plays for which the writer is unknown are attributed to the Konparu family.

sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 『いろは作者註文』は、いろは順に能の曲名を並べた一覧（名寄）に、作者名を注記した作者付。
sen.e: "Iroha Sakusha Chumon" is a sakushazuke that lists noh song names according to the iroha ordering of Japanese phonetic kana annotates these with the names of the writers.
"Iroha Sakusha Chumon" is a sakushazuke that lists noh song names according to the iroha ordering of Japanese phonetic kana annotates these with the names of the writers.
"Iroha Sakusha Chumon" is sakushazuke that lists the names of noh songs according to the ordering of Japanese phonetic kana with annotations of the names of the writers.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 元になった名寄は、近世以降には見られない古曲を多く含んでおり、室町後期のものと見られている。
sen.e: The original list on which this book was based included many ancient songs that had not been seen since the early modern period which appear to date from the latter part of the Muromachi period.
The original list on which this book was based included many ancient songs that had not been seen since the early modern period which appear to date from the latter part of the Muromachi period.
The original list, on which this book was based, included many ancient songs that had not been seen since the early modern period, which appear to date from the latter part of the Muromachi period.

sen.j: その後、天正6年（1578年）から文禄3年（1594年）の期間に行われた増補を経て、現在の形になったらしい。
sen.e: The additions made between 1578 and 1594 resulted in its current form.
The additions made between 1578 and 1594 resulted in its current form.

sen.j: 『能本作者註文』と同じ原資料などに基づいて作者名の注記が行われており、内容的にはその異本に当たる。
sen.e: This book was created based on the same original sources as "Nohon Sakusha Chumon" and annotated with writer names but the content varies between editions.
This book was created based on the same original sources as "Nohon Sakusha Chumon" and annotated with writer names but the content varies between editions.
This book has the writer names annotated based on the same original sources as those of "Nohon Sakusha Chumon", but as for the content, it is an alternative version.

sen.j: そのため、『能本作者註文』の伝本の見直しに役立つ。

sen.j: 『自家伝抄』は、16世紀初頭に成立したと見られる能の伝書。
sen.e: "Jika Densho" is a noh text that is thought to have been written at the beginning of the 16th century.

sen.j: その内容は前半が作者付、後半が雑多な伝書の抄録となっており、「自家の伝書の抄」であることからこの題が付けられたと思われる。
sen.e: This book is thought to have gained its title (lit. Personal Excerpts' due to the fact that it is a collection of excerpts of noh related texts possessed by the author of which first half of this is a sakushazuke and the second half is composed of miscellaneous excerpts of noh texts.

sen.j: ただし、前半の作者付だけが『自家伝抄』と呼ばれることも多い。

sen.j: 編者として、前半部には嘉吉2年（1442年）、後半部には応永21年（1414年）の世阿弥による署名があり、世阿弥の著書として紹介されたこともあるが、信じることは出来ない。
sen.e: The facts that Zeamin served as compiler and that the first half was signed by him in 1442 and the second half in 1414 means that he is sometimes credited as being the author but this cannot be believed.

sen.j: また『風口』という伝書中に本著の内容が含まれ、その末尾には金春禅鳳の署名があるが、こちらも記述内容の相違から、仮託と考えられる。
sen.e: The content of this publication is included in a book entitled "Kazekuchi" which also features the signature of Zenpo KONPARU at the end but this is believed to be false due to the discrepancy from the book's content.

sen.j: 同書には続けて、禅鳳から相伝したとして永正13年（1516年）常門孫四郎吉次の署名があり、この人物が実際の編者である可能性が高い。
sen.e: This book also includes the signature of Magojiro Yoshitsugu TSUNEKADO who suceeded Zenpo, and it is highly likely that he served as editor.

sen.j: 常門吉次の来歴は不明だが、金春流の素人、ないし半玄人であったと見られる。
sen.e: Little is known of Yoshitsugu TSUNEKADO's career but it appears that he was an amateur or semi-professional of the Konparu-ryu school.

sen.j: 作者付としては前述の『能本作者註文』系の諸本とは大きく食い違う説を掲載している。
sen.e: As a sakushazuke, its content widely differs from the previously described "Nohon Sakusha Chumon" related books.

sen.j: しかしその所説は必ずしも信用出来るとは限らず、取り扱いには警戒が必要である。
sen.e: Therefor its content cannot necessarily be trusted and it is important that it is used with caution.
Therefore its content cannot necessarily be trusted and it is important that it is used with caution.
Therefore, its content cannot necessarily be trusted and it should be used with caution.

sen.j: しかし外山・佐阿弥・十二次郎・観世元雅越智観世など他の作者付には見られない作者が挙げられ、これらの人物については信用のおける古書を参照しているとも考えることも出来、信頼には検討を要するとは言え、傍証が得られれば重要な資料となり得る。
sen.e: However, it includes writers such as Sotoyama, Saami, Junijiro, Kanze Motomasa and Ochi Kanze who do not appear in other sakushazuke and it can be thought that details regarding these indivisuals is based on credible ancient books, so although it is important to remain sceptical, this book will become a valuable resource if its content can be corroborated.

However, it includes writers such as Sotoyama, Saami, Junijiro, Kanze Motomasa and Ochi Kanze who do not appear in other sakushazuke and it can be thought that details regarding these indivisuals is based on credible ancient texts, so although it is important to remain sceptical, this book will become a valuable resource if its content can be corroborated.

tit.j: 観世太夫書上・金春八左衛門書上

sen.j: 能役者の各家が、徳川幕府に提出した文書。
sen.e: These are the documents that all noh actors submitted to the Tokugawa Shogunate.
These are the documents that all noh actors submitted to the Tokugawa Shogunate.
These are the documents that all noh actors submitted to the Tokugawa Shogunate.

sen.j: 能作者についての各家の所伝が記されている。
sen.e: They contain details of each performer.
They contain details of each performer.
They contain details of each performer.

sen.j: しかしその信頼性は乏しく、現在では資料としてはそれほど価値がない。
sen.e: However, they are unreliable and not have no current value as historical sources.
However, they are unreliable and do not current value as historical sources.
However, they are unreliable and do not have current value as historical sources.

sen.j: 『二百十番謡目録』は、明和2年（1765年）6月、十五世観世大夫・観世元章が著した作者付。
sen.e: "Nihyakujuban Utai Mokuroku" is a sakushazuke that was written in June of 1765 by and kanze Kanze Motoakira, 15th head of the Kanze School.
"Nihyakujuban Utai Mokuroku" is a sakushazuke that was written in June of 1765 by and kanze Kanze Motoakira, 15th head of the Kanze School.
"Nihyakujuban Utai Mokuroku" is a sakushazuke that was written in June 1765 by Kanze Motoakira, 15th head of the Kanze School.

sen.j: 元章は国学の影響を受け、「明和の改正」と言われる能の詞章の大変更を行い、新たに謡本を編纂したが、本著はその目録に作者名を注記したものである。
sen.e: Influenced by the study of (ancient) Japanese literature and culture, Motoakira undertook a major revision of noh poetry and prose known as the 'Meiwa no Kaitei' (lit. Major Revision of the Meiwa era) and edited utaibon (books of words and musical notation for noh plays) of which this book serves as a catalogue in which each play isannotated with the names of its writers.

Influenced by the study of (ancient) Japanese literature and culture, Motoakira undertook a major revision of noh poetry and prose known as the 'Meiwa no Kaitei' (lit. Major Revision of the Meiwa era) and edited utaibon (books of words and musical notation for noh plays) of which this book serves as a catalogue in which each play is annotated with the names of its writers.

Influenced by the study of (ancient) Japanese literature and culture, Motoakira undertook a major revision of noh poetry and prose known as the 'Meiwa no Kaitei' (lit. Major Revision during the Meiwa era) and compiled utaibon (books of words and musical notation for noh plays); this book has the names of its writers annotated in the catalogue of the book.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 同時に刊行された『独吟八十五曲目録』と合わせ、245番の作者が挙げられている。
sen.e: This book and "Dokugin Hachijyugokyoku Mokuroku" published during the same period list a combined total of 245 noh writers.
This book and "Dokugin Hachijyugokyoku Mokuroku" published during the same period list a combined total of 245 noh writers.
This book and "Dokugin Hachijyugokyoku Mokuroku" published during the same period list a combined total of 245 noh writers.

sen.j: 本著は先に挙げた先行の作者付を参考にして書かれ、『金春八左衛門書上』、そして『観世太夫書上』・『自家伝抄』の一部を重視し、『能本作者註文』・『歌謡作者考』を参照しつつ、加えて現在知られていない伝書の説も取り入れたと考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that this book was written based on the above described sakushazuke, emphasizes parts of "Konparu Hachizaemon Kakiage", "Kanze Dayu Kakiage" and "Jika Densho", and draws inspiration from "Nohon Sakusha Chumon" and "Kayo Sakusha Ko" in addition to incorporating the theories now unknown texts.

It is thought that this book was written based on the above described sakushazuke, emphasizes parts of "Konparu Hachizaemon Kakiage", "Kanze Dayu Kakiage" and "Jika Densho", and draws inspiration from "Nohon Sakusha Chumon" and "Kayo Sakusha Ko" in addition to incorporating the theories now unknown texts.

It is thought that this book was written based on the prior sakushazuke, emphasizes parts of "Konparu Hachizaemon Kakiage," "Kanze Dayu Kakiage" and "Jika Densho," and draws inspiration from "Nohon Sakusha Chumon" and "Kayo Sakusha Ko" in addition to incorporating the views of the texts now unknown.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし元章は各作者付の信頼度については深く検討せず、結果として誤りの多い資料を無批判に採り入れる一方、逆に『申楽談儀』『五音』など根本資料と言える世阿弥の著書も見ていなかったらしい。
sen.e: However, Motoakira did not place great emphasis on the reliability of the sakushazuke on which he based his work and as such, not only did he unquestioningly adopted sources containing numerous errors but it also appears as though he did not refer to fundamental sources such as "Sarugaku Dangi" an "Go On".

However, Motoakira did not place great emphasis on the reliability of the sakushazuke on which he based his work and as such, not only did he unquestioningly adopted sources containing numerous errors but it also appears as though he did not refer to fundamental sources such as "Sarugaku Dangi" an "Go On".

However, Motoakira did not place great emphasis on the reliability of the sakushazuke, on which he based his work and as such, not only did he unquestioningly adopted sources containing numerous mistakes but it also appears as though he did not refer to fundamental sources such as "Sarugaku Dangi" an "Go On."
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: そのため、原資料が判明している現在、本著には資料としての価値は認められない。
sen.e: It is for this reason that this publication is not considered to have any value as a historical source now that the original source materials are known.
It is for this reason that this publication is not considered to have any value as a historical source now that the original source materials are known.
It is for this reason that this publication is not considered to have any value as a historical source now that the original source materials are known.

sen.j: ただし、未発見の作者付に拠ったらしい少数の曲については参考になる。
sen.e: It has, howeve become a reference for the small number of songs that appear to have been written by undiscovered sakushazuke.
It has, howeve become a reference for the small number of songs that appear to have been written by undiscovered sakushazuke.
It has, however, become a reference for the small number of songs that appear to have been written by lost and unknown sakushazuke.
